question.question_subtype: Select One or More Answer Choices
question.stimulus: This is a stimulus for a test
question.question_stem:
Missing important detail: An astrophysicist from the Harvard-Smithsonian Center has predicted a galactic storm.
With detail added: An astrophysicist from the Harvard-Smithsonian Center has predicted that a galactic storm will occur within the next 10 million years.

Without the additional information about __________, most readers would wonder when the storm was supposed to occur. The added detail makes the sentence clearer.

explanations.A: Incorrect. Place provides context but doesn't directly address when the event will occur.
explanations.B: Correct! Time is crucial in this case to clarify when the galactic storm will occur.
explanations.C: Incorrect. Reason could explain why the event will happen but doesn't address the timing aspect.
explanations.D: Incorrect. Magnitude might describe the scale of the event but does not clarify the time frame.

question_details.learning_outcome: Students will understand how adding temporal details can enhance clarity and make predictions in sentences more understandable.
question_details.learning_objective: This topic focuses on the importance of adding time-related information to improve the precision and readability of sentences.
